title: Life Science SP.2.a
prompt:
Researchers conducted an experiment for a new drug intended to treat a respiratory disorder. The test was undertaken over a one week period. During this time, three hundred participants lived and slept in a controlled environment and were continually monitored. Half of the participants were given no drug, but were simply monitored as a control group. The other half of the participants were given the proposed drug treatment. By the end of the study, the experimental group showed a 12% improvement in lung function over the control group. The researchers concluded that the drug is a valid treatment for the respiratory disorder.

Which of the following would be the best improvement to this experiment?
feedback: The biggest problem with the experiment is that it isn’t “blind.” Participants who know they are receiving the treatment might be subject to a “placebo effect.” That is, they will feel better because they believe that they should be feeling better. If neither the control group or the experimental group knows who is receiving the treatment, the placebo effect has equal potential to affect either group, thus diminishing it as a factor.
